Description:
Part of Against the Odds Magazine's Pocket Battle Games series, this is the fourth of their "Five For Fighting" series of linked games covering the D-Day invasion.

LPS Pocket Battle Game #24
Families: Series: Five for Fighting (Against the Odds)

Name: The Sword Beach Landings
Description:
Part of Against the Odds Magazine's Pocket Battle Games series, this is the fifth of their "Five For Fighting" series of linked games covering the D-Day invasion.

LPS Pocket Battle Game #25
Families: Series: Five for Fighting (Against the Odds)

Name: Tuesday, The Führer Slept Late
Description: A set of rules and scenario information that combines the "Five for Fighting" series of Pocket Battle Games from Against the Odds.  released as part of a D-Day anniversary special.
Families: Series: Five for Fighting (Against the Odds)

Name: Zheng He Goes to the West Coast
Description:
Starting from a city state in Mesopotamia, you expand your empire to every corner of the Old World, and finally set sail to invade the Americas. The entire history of the human race is replayed within an hour.
You roll dice and fill the numbers in the blanks on your world map. Choose your dice cleverly, as the rest are used by the other players.

—description from the designer

Name: Rifles, Railroads and Rebellions: Fast Play Wargame for the American Civil War and Later 19th Century Conflicts
Description:
Rifles, Railroads and Rebellions is based upon C’est la Guerre: Fast Play Wargame for the Age of Muskets. This system was designed to provide a fast yet satisfying game play, not necessarily a “realistic” simulation of battle recreation. Bases or ‘Units’ in the game do not represent a certain number of men or artillery pieces but are abstract representations of force.

Rifles, Railroads and Rebellions uses

- a simple command structure to manage battlefield movement without dealing with morale or having the players issue orders,

- a troop grading system so that better trained more effective troops can have an advantage over poorly trained less effective troops, and

- a method to account for casualties and losses without an overly complicated accounting system.

Rifles, Railroads and Rebellions is an abstraction. A Unit in the game does not necessarily equal a particular organizational unit, formation in the field, or a specific number of soldiers. Each base is a representation of force, and as such issues such as the size of one battalion, regiment, brigade, or squadron should be set aside. The player should concern himself with tactics such as troop placement, command access, gun placement and terrain features. The goal is to recreate the “feel” of the period, not necessarily every detail of it.

-description from publisher

Name: Cultist/Occultist
Description:
Cultist/Occultist has you taking on the role of either trying to save the world from utter destruction, or trying to usher into it your dark god from beyond time and space. This is a social deduction game where there's more to do than just figure out who is on the other team, you also need to strategize to stop them!

Each turn of the game will have the players collectively trying to start or prevent a ritual from taking place. The leader of the ritual will determine which one to attempt This is done by contributing different components to the ritual that will either aid or hinder its attempted effect. Be careful though! Too many failed ritual attempts can have another bad effect.

Each ritual slightly alters the fabric of reality, and can change how the game itself plays. Some rituals will make future rituals easier to pass, while others will give certain players new abilities and things that they can do. Between this and different Great Old Ones, no two play-throughs will be the same.

—description from the designer

Name: Uncaged: Brazilian Jiu Jitsu Starter Deck
Description:
Tap, Nap or Snap. The Choice is Yours.

After rising to dominance following the first UNCAGED tournament, Brazilian Jiu Jitsu master Rei has gone missing. With another tournament on the horizon, who will take his place representing the gentle art? Enter 3 of his pupils, all seeking to prove their mastery!

The Uncaged: Brazilian Jiu Jitsu Starter deck can be played stand alone out of the box, or combined with other UNCAGED decks.

—description from the publisher

Name: Uncaged: Kung Fu Starter Deck
Description:
Flow like water.

Three Kung Fu experts have arrived at the Uncaged tournament to represent their ancient martial art! Behold Eagle, Monkey and Mantis! A deadly dance of fists cementing Kung Fu's rightful place on the world stage!

The Uncaged: Kung Fu Starter deck can be played stand along out of the box, or combined with other Uncaged decks.

—description from the publisher

Name: Uncaged: Training Gym. Deck Building Essentials
Description:
It's time to step up your game.

Get back in the gym and hone your fighter's skills with this booster set of punches, kicks, submissions and takedowns. Be ready to inflict some serious damage standing or on the ground. But remember, the only fighting style that matters is yours!

This is not a standalone product. Use your Training Gym to customize or build your own Uncaged: World Fighters deck.

—description from the publisher

Name: Super Tic Tac Toe
Description:
Two player game played with different colored pegs on 4x4 grid of holes.

"Each player uses different color pegs. The object of the game is to get your pegs of the same color in a square in all four corners, four in a row up and down, across, or diagonally at the same time try to block your opponent from scoring a Super TTT  first... Just like ordinary Tic Tac Toe but a lot more fun."

From the simplicity of the game it would seem to mean a square of pegs in a 2x2 grid location. An interesting variation might include any geometric square.

Name: Instant Hockey
Description:
2-player card game about Ice Hockey. No knowledga of Ice Hockey needed!
First player to have 3 goals wins.
Players play cards from their deck into a 3x2 game area for each player. Cards are compared in each 3 column. Winner in each column has a greater card values in that column. Then each winning columns are added together and highest value wins the situation (turn).

It´s possible to win with a lower value cards a player that plays higher value cards. That´s when cards are played wisely.

IH introduces an interesting new game mechanic: Deduction Deck Mechanic.

—description from the designer

DDM is a card mechanic where two values are compared. Winning value (higher) and losing value (lower). Then from results deck is drawn as many cards as is the winning value. The losing party (player) then deducts (eliminates) the most bad cards from that set: Goals and worst Penalties. 
After that the winning player chooses from the remaining cards the outcome of the situation: Goal, Penalties, Powerplay etc.

Name: Olympische Spiele München 1972
Description:
The players compete in 10 sports. The results for each sport are determined in different ways by rolling 1 or 2 dice and are marked by meeples on the game board. For each sport points are awarded which are written on a piece of paper. The player with the most points wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Uptown
Description:
Uptown is a 3D-stacking strategy game where players take turns placing a tetracube of any colour on the game board trying to dominate at least four columns.

COMPONENTS

- A checkered game board with 35 squares arranged in seven columns.

- 8 red and 8 grey tetracubes.

A tetracube is a geometric form that consists of four cubes joined.

HOW TO PLAY
 Each player has an allocated colour (red or grey). Red player begins. Take turns placing a tetracube of any colour on the game board according to the following constraints:

1. At least one of its cubes must rest directly on the board, within a square.

2. No cube may rest outside the game board boundaries.

3. No cube may “hang in the air” without support from below.

The game ends when the player in turn has no legal moves.

WINNING THE GAME

The score is set column by column. A column is dominated by the colour that occupies at least three of the five squares when the game board is looked upon from above. The player dominating at least four columns wins the game.

-description from designer

Name: Schwerpunkt: Volume 21
Description: 12 ASL scenarios for the Advanced Squad Leader system.

Name: Rally Point 9
Description: A special study ASL Mapboards 7a/b, 8a/b and 9a/b. It includes 10 new scenarios from the Tampa ASL Group.

Name: Star Realms: Assault Shuttle
Description:
Promo card for Star Realms.
Most recently given out at Gen Con 2019 and SPIEL'19.

Cost: 2
Faction/Color: Red and Yellow
Primary ability: 4 Damage
Ally Ability: Destroy target base

Flavored text: These formidable ships have taught the Blobs to be more careful where they establish bases.

Name: Robotech: Force of Arms – Grand Cannon Promo Expansion
Description:
This is a 5-card promo expansion (including 1new "Ship" Card -ThevGrand Cannon. 1new Hero and Command Card for each Player

To use The Grand Cannon, replace the "Empty Space" Card from the main game and place The Grand Cannon Card in the center of the space sector during the Sey Up.

When the players move ships during the tactical phase of the game, the Grand canyon can be selected only as the second card to be moved. The Grand canyon can only switch places with a ship if it is orthodontically adjacent (Above, Below, Left, or Right)

Found in the back of Game Time Magazine handed out during Origins 2019.

Name: Xero-G
Description:
Xero-G is a sci-fi themed strategy game designed to be played with Components: Looney Pyramid Games. It is a two-player game with zero luck and perfect information, played on a 6×6 grid.

Players take on the role of spaceship pilots from warring planets, each competing to the be first to invade their opponent's alien base. Pyramids represent vacant spaceships available for use by either player. Movement is orthogonal, increases with the size of the ship, and can be supplemented by boosts and special movement rules.

Name: Trains & Cargo
Description:
Collect cargo, load it onto your train, then send off the train to score points based on the market values of the cargo at the time. Lower the values of your opponent's cargo while keeping what is on your own train high, upgrade your locomotive to pull longer trains, steal and sabotage, and choose a route to send your train along to score bonus points.

Trains & Cargo is a strategic, casual board game for 2-4 or 6 players, individually or in teams. There are two types of locomotives, eight types of cargo (coal, timber, corn, cars, steel, food, cattle and passengers) and three Route Boards that you can claim to score bonus points.

Each turn you may choose to either play cards from your hand, upgrade your locomotive, or to send off your train to score points for the cargo it holds. There are three types of cards and you may play up to one of each type on any given turn: Cargo Cards to collect cargo from a central bank, Market Cards to increase or decrease the values of specified cargo, and Effect Cards with various text-based abilities.

Things to consider when playing Trains & Cargo include what cards to combine for maximum effect, how long to wait until you send off your train, if you should wait for a specific route to become available or choose a different path, and more. The game is entirely free of play money which means that getting a head start early on does not mean a certain win - you are limited by the cards in your hand, not the money in your bank.

—description from the designer

Name: Canine Chaos Card Game: Celebrity Edition
Description:
Join this a-list cast of canine celebrities for a fast and frantic CARD-SWAPPING GAME of canine craziness.

Players compete to be the first to complete three matching sets of celebrity dogs in this matching, set collection game. The first to complete 3 sets wins, but play continues until all players have completed their sets.

—description from the publisher

Name: Name it
Description:
Name It is a Draw-a-card-&-write game which is based on an Iranian traditional party game called Esm-o-Famil (First name and family name).

In Name It, players try to name as many words in various categories as they can with the each letter card revealed.
There are also a deck of Event Cards, starting a cool challenge in every round of the game. The main part of the game is writing, but some parts are done orally.

In every round a card revealed which has a letter on it and then all players simultaneously try to write down a word with that letter in categories shown on a category card (which is varied from personal to entertainment). Each player scores for his/her right words and at the end the player with the most points wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Enchanters: Odyssey
Description:
Enchanters: Odyssey is a game-altering expansion, that comes with:

     variable starting powers - become Dwarven Cultist or Gnoll Druid and use your talents to guide you to victory
     physical coop and solo mode - a new mode that lets you play with your * non-competitive friends or no friends at all
     6 new Kingdoms (with corresponding Overlords and Villages) - each with a new distinct mechanic to combine with previous decks
     All themed around the journey through mythological antiquity.


—description from the designer

The Railroads of Bornholm is a member of the 18xxx series of games. 1899+1 is set on the Danish island Bornholm. Here the railways came late (in 1900) so that explains the name of the game. You can call it 18Born if you don't like the pun.

Two, three, or four players represent investors in railroad companies, spending their initial capital to purchase shares in railway companies. The companies, each controlled by the largest shareholder, build track and run trains to earn revenue. These can be paid out as dividends to shareholders to retained to fund further track and trains. A key feature of 1899+1, as with all other games in the series, is that the interest of the President and the interest of the shareholders are not identical, so minority shareholders need to be careful with their investments. Being a President is not without its difficulties, either; bailing out an insolvent company is the sole responsibility of its President.

1899+1, while short by standards of other members of the series, is a fairly long game. Experienced players can expect to take up to three hours to complete a game.

Name: Mamlejet Kohanim: Una Nación Eterna
Description:
Mamlejet Kohanim is a semi-collaborative collectible card game, set in the time of the first Kings of ancient Israel, in which each player assumes the role of Commander of a Division of the King's Army. The players are allied to each other, and the objective of the game is to be the first to demoralize the enemy army through different tactics: soldiers, objects, and other strategy cards. The combats are resolved by dice rolls.

—description from the publisher

Name: Thrive: Pond Life
Description:
With nightfall, the lotus sinks underwater to rest until the new day.  However, the pond does not rest and new creatures begin to emerge.

Thrive: Pond Life offers players new ways to play Thrive.  More colored pegs allow a 3rd and 4th player to the pond, variable power cards "bend" the normal rules of play, and variable setups keep your pond fresh.  The Pond Life also includes a brand new variant to discover a completely new way to play inside.

—description from the publisher

Name: Producers & Consumers
Description:
An exciting way to learn about producers and consumers!  Producers and Consumers is an educational game designed to teach the basic economic concepts of production, consumption, bartering and specialization to students in grades 1-3.

Each player draws a card depicting a profession and gets several resource tokens related to their job.  On the back of their card is their goal--the resources they must collect to win.  Players must then trade to try to collect all the resources they need.  The first player to collect all the necessary resources wins.

The game can be played at three levels.  At level one, resources are plentiful and all players should be able to complete their cards with simple one-to-one trades.  At level two, some resources are scarcer and some players have a smaller supply, so one-to-one trades may not be sufficient to complete cards.  At level three, there are not enough resources for all players to complete their cards, so competition for some resources may be fierce!

Name: Funnybones
Description:
5 small plastic pieces which are tossed from the hand to play several different games. The boxed game includes a rules sheet and a small drawstring bag to hold everything.

The plastic pieces are shaped like "knucklebones" (astragalus) and are in 5 different bright colors.

There are 25 games or challenges in the rules. The games would involve things like tossing the 5 pieces from palm and catching them in palm. Or tossing them from palm and catching them on the back of the hand.

—user summary

Name: Fly Guy's Buzz Words Game
Description:
Fly Guy's Buzz Words Game is an educational game allowing early readers to practice sight words.

The game comes in a "trash can" with a 3D Fly Guy character on top.  Players are dealt a hand of very small blue cards with common one-syllable words.  The same words appear on a deck of red cards.

Players take turns drawing a card from the red deck, reading the word aloud and then trying to make a match with a blue card they hold.  It they match, they yell "Swat!" and put the matching cards back in the can by dropping them through Fly Guy's mouth.

If the active player cannot make a match, other players have an opportunity to match the drawn red card in the same way.

The red deck also includes "Lose a Turn" and "Give 1 Card to Any Player" cards.  The latter allows the current player to give one of his blue cards to another player before taking his/her turn normally.

The first player to throw all of his or her cards into the garbage buzzes to victory.

Name: Pirate Quest
Description:
A quick, engaging game of treasure hunting with a twist!

Welcome to Pirate Quest! Be the Pirate Ghost, create the treasure island by laying down cards randomly, and then hide the treasure. Then follow the actions of the other pirates as they try to find the ultimate treasure chest.

Stop them, confuse them, move them around the island, and gather their willpower in order to release your captured soul!

In Pirate Quest one player is the ghost of a long forgotten pirate captain who tries to stop the other pirates finding his ultimate treasure chest. The players will move around the randomized island trying to dig and figure out where the chest is. Every action they take fills the Will power of the ghost. If they cannot find the chest in time, the ghost will be released and everyone will lose. But if one of them finds the chest, he or she will be the winner!

—description from the publisher

Name: Vettrip
Description:
The objective of the game is to have fun remembering knowledge, intuiting answers and learning new things about health and animals. The game consists of advancing through the digestive system of the snake that translates into the question posed. Advance or backward in the function of the squares bet on hearing the statement of the question.

The estimated time for a game is 1-2 hours. It is suitable for any age, but it is not suitable for children under 10 years of age.

The 400 cards that contain the game allow hours of entertainment without repeating any question.

Name: The Artemis Project: Directives
Description: The Artemis Project: Directives is a set of fifteen cards that gives players optional goals to accomplish over the course of the game.

Name: Change Up
Description:
Change Up is a fast-paced, easy to learn game with three rounds. It's important to keep track of where the Point Cards end up. You'll place the five Point Cards face down on the table in order from 0 to 4. Then, everyone will draw six cards to make a hand letting them do things like move the face down Point Cards, mess with other players' hands, and get the chance to pick first to get that elusive 4-point Point Card. Record the score you get from the card at the end of each round. Whoever has the highest score at the end of three rounds is the winner.

—description from the designer

Name: Dust 1947: Luftwaffe Fallschirm RSO Flak/Laserkanone/Pak 40
Description:
The Raupenschlepper Ost is a dedicated light and airdrop vehicle in service with the Luftwaffe ground forces. Thanks to its weight, it can be parachuted along with the airborne troops, offering them a much needed fire support during the first phase of an operation. This reference allows you to field one of three variants: an antiaircraft version, an antitank version with antitank gun and an antitank version with laser gun. All crews on the pictures are included.

This item comes with three Dust 1947 Unit Cards, one for each variant, for the Luftwaffe Faction of the Axis Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dust 1947: Steel Guards Headquarters
Description:
Steel Guards are some of the most formidable fighters on the planet. Their half-robotic bodies makes them very hard to kill, allowing them to gain incredible combat experience. And among them are a few that are even more formidable: Master Sergeant Guaï-Lo Moloï is one of them. The third human on the planet (and last one alive) to ever be encased in a Steel Guard armor, he has seen action in every part of the World. His armor has been heavily modified to his specifications, making him a fearsome sight on the battlefield.
Officers of the Steel Guards Command Squad direct their comrades on the battlefield and are formidable warriors in their own right. They have seen and been through the worse, many times. There's nothing on the planet they can't handle.
This Headquarters reference includes this Hero and this Command Squad.

This item comes with two Dust 1947 Unit Cards, for the Guards Army Faction. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dust 1947: Pounder/Hot Dog
Description:
The Mickey chassis has been the first walker ever available for the Allies Bloc, thanks to the cunning of Joe Brown and the incredible engineering skills of Rosie Donovan. The first models were equipped with regular tanks weapons, that are still incredibly effective on this new chassis: the dreaded Pounder mounts a powerful antitank gun capable of dealing with any armored threat, while the Hotdog's massive flamethrower ravages with flame whole areas of the battlefield.
This reference allows you to field one of these two variants.

This reference comes with two Dust 1947 unit cards, one for each variant, for the Allied Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dust 1947: USMC Heavy Machine Gun Squad and Heavy Mortar Squad
Description:
When the Allies Bloc was formed, all armed forces joined the grand Allied Army. Well except the United States Marine Corps who said thanks but no thanks. We're going to keep our name and our traditions and we'll welcome anyone who wants to join but we're going to remain the USMC.
This reference allows you to field one USMC Heavy Mortar Squad and one USMC Heavy Machinegun Squad.

This reference comes with two Dust 1947 unit cards, all for the USMC Faction of the Allies Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dust 1947: USMC Headquarters
Description:
When the Allies Bloc was formed, all armed forces joined the grand Allied Army. Well except the United States Marine Corps who said thanks but no thanks. We're going to keep our name and our traditions and we'll welcome anyone who wants to join but we're going to remain the USMC.
This Headquarters reference includes three Heroes and the USMC Command Squad. The Heroes are Machete Mack, a brilliant Officer; Crazy Jimmy, an incredible walker pilot; and Frank, a deadly fighter.

This reference comes with four Dust 1947 unit cards, all for the USMC Faction of the Allies Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dust 1947: Heinrich Tropical/Hermann Tropical
Description:
Quick and agile, the tropicalized Panzerspähläufer chassis is a staple of the Neue Deutsches Afrikakorps armored forces. It can mount an impressive array of weapons while retaining an incredible speed on the battlefield.
This reference allows you to assemble one of two variants. The Heinrich (Trop) is equipped with powerful antiaircraft guns, also efficient against light armored targets. The Hermann (Trop) is armed with coupled laser guns capable of destroying any tank or walker. Both variants also have a machine-gun to deal with infantry threats.

This reference comes with two Dust 1947 unit cards, one for each variant, both for the NDAK Faction of the Axis Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dust 1947: Nina (TSH)/Mikhail (TSH)
Description:
Armed with two rocket launchers, the Nina (Tsh) is a staple of SSU forces around the planet. This tropicalized variant is used by the dreaded Spetsnaz, who enjoy the firepower and versatility of this walker. The Mikhail (Tsh) is an engineer walker who brings unique skills to the battlefield. This reference allows you to field one of these two variants.

This reference comes with two Dust 1947 unit cards, one for each variant, both for the Spetsnaz Faction of the SSU Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dust 1947: Sergei ISU-203/Evgenyi ISU-350
Description:
Since 1943 the ISU format, a heavy self-propelled gun mounted on a tank chassis, has become a staple of the SSU armored forces. Easy and cheap to build, efficient and deadly, these vehicles are now found everywhere on the planet where the SSU fights. The Sergei mounts a very heavy antitank gun, capable of knocking out any enemy armored target. The Evgeny is armed with the largest assault howitzer ever mounted on a ground vehicle.
This reference allows you to field one of these two variants.

This reference comes with two Dust 1947 unit cards, one for each variant, both for the SSU Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dust 1947: Operation Hellgate
Description:
Nothing will be the same! Operation Hellgate, the aftermath of Operation Kondor, has started and concludes the Babylon cycle. A new force appears in the World of Dust, one that will change it forever! But new heroes rise, along with new technologies, to counterattack and defend maybe more than just their own Bloc now.

This new expansion for Dust 1947 describes the Mythos and Desert Scorpion forces, with new characters, vehicles, Platoons, etc. With the Operation itself come several short stories and great art by Daniel Zrom!

We also included a few things like missing unit cards and game tokens.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dust 1947: Desert Scorpions Starter Set – Taskforce Shaun
Description:
The Desert Scorpions of the Long Range Desert Group have arrived to fight for Freedom and gain a definitive upper hand in this Endless War. Their presence will surely have a great impact on the World's events, as they form one of the most seasoned military formation in the Grand Allied Army. Coming from many countries where citizens just want to be freed or protected from tyranny, the Desert Scorpions are deadly foes.

Taskforce Shaun includes the following units:

     Shaun (one Hero)
     The Desert Scorpion Assault Squad (5 miniatures)
     one Tank Hunter Truck (one vehicle)


Everything you need to start a new glorious Desert Scorpions Army is included in this box! Please note that the Dust 1947 Starter rules, a durable neoprene gaming mat, terrain, dice, etc. are included in this Starter Set.

Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, they come already assembled and primed. They're ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over them, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dust 1947: Desert Scorpions Kill Squad
Description:
Reinforcements have arrived for the Desert Scorpions! The Kill Squad is here to provide unique skills and abilities to fight for Freedom and gain a definitive upper hand in this Endless War. Its presence will surely have a great impact on the battlefield, using overwhelmingly Phaser firepower to destroy anything on the battlefield that is not in the air!

This reference comes with its own Dust 1947 unit card. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

—description from the publisher

Name: Murder on the Cosmic Express: Upon Further Examination
Description: Upon Further Examination is a small expansion that adds six new weapon cards (3x gun, 3x rope) and three new characters (Hacked Security Bot, Doctor, and Ambassador), allowing the game to be played with up to 9 players.

Name: Dust 1947: Mi-Go Raiders Squad
Description:
The Fungi from Yuggoth -as the Mi-Go are also known- travel through time and space to do the bidding of the Mythos Gods. Praising Nyarlathotep and Shub-Niggurath, they are the most alien of races, compared to humans. The Mi-Go use weird technology in every part of their strange lives, as well as when they wage war against their numerous enemies. The Raiders are armed with copper apparatus that resembles Earth's weapons but who fire devastating rays of energy.

This reference comes with its own Dust 1947 unit card, for the Mythos Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dust 1947: PLA/Red Army Sarnai and Grom
Description:
Captain “Red Lightning” Sarnai
Hero of the Sino-Soviet Union – 1946
Hero of the Soviet Union – 1944
Order of Lenin – 1944
Order of the Patriotic War – 1943
Order of the Red Star – 1943
Born 1921 in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia, Sarnai is one of the most famous and decorated pilot of the VVS (Voyenno-Vozdushnye Sily), the Sino-Soviet Union Military Air Forces. With her father being one of the rare pilots in her home country, Sarnai learned to fly at an early age. A natural talent, she started flying between her hometown and Irkutsk, carrying love letters, precious merchandises and shady characters. When her country officially joined the war effort against Axis powers, she then joined the newly formed Mongolian Arat Squadron, in 1943. Her impressive skills soon proved to be invaluable and she was transferred to the 46th “Taman” Guards Night Bomber Aviation Regiment (the “Night Witches”). Accumulating an impressive score of victories, she was tasked to form the 179th Guards Assault Aviation Regiment that she now commands. It was the first unit to receive the “Grom” (thunder in Russian)in the Red Air Force. The Mil Mi-47Z “Grom” Tesla Assault Helicopter is the latest addition to the already impressive arsenal of the VVS. Quickly catching up with their German counterparts, the Soviet engineers have miniaturized their VK generator enough so they can fit inside the tight fuselage of an attack helicopter. This gives the aircraft a tremendous firepower, almost without equal on the planet. It takes incredible piloting skills to hit anything with Tesla guns from the air, but the results are devastating: the whole enemy aircraft shuts down, its controls (or pilot...) fried.

This reference comes with three Dust 1947 unit cards. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

—description from the publisher

Name: Mansions of Madness: Second Edition – Path of the Serpent: Expansion
Description:
Now in Mansions of Madness, you take on the role of Arkham’s bravest investigators who must step into the unexplored wilderness of the Amazon jungle and explore crumbling ruins, discover the secrets of lost civilizations, and stop a serpent’s curse before the world descends into chaos. In three new scenarios, you will battle horrifying serpent creatures, face stone monstrosities that come to life, and beat the ever-present danger of being lost to the jungle forever.

Four new characters, four new monsters.

The scenarios:
In The Jungle Awakens - a lavish Arkham garden party shows off the host's recent acquisitions from a South American expedition.

Into the Dark - your team of investigators have been hired to assist a South American expedition.

Lost Temple of Yig - takes your investigators to ancient stone halls where serpentine priests attempt to reforge their broken bonds with their god, Yig.

The new characters:
Leo Anderson - able to help his allies cut through the jungle underbrush and allows them to move one space when he performs a move action.

Ursula Downs, the explorer. Once per round, she may listen to the call of the unknown and choose to move one space before or after exploring or interacting with a sight token.

Daniela Reyes, the mechanic - whenever she or one of her comrades solves a puzzle during an adventure, she may either gain two clues or discard one horror.

Norman Withers, Miskatonic Astronomer - May gain two clues or discard one horror once per round, provided he is in an outdoor space where he can read what is written in the stars.
Families: Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Just One: Gathering of Friends Promo Cards
Description:
A set of three promo cards distributed at the 2019 Gathering of Friends.  These cards feature words themed around the Gathering of Friends, which is an annual meet-up of board game enthusiasts hosted by game designer Alan R. Moon.

—user summary

Name: Mystery Detective Vol. 2: Funny Death and Real Life Cases
Description:
Mystery Detective is a mystery solving party game that you can start playing almost as soon as you open the box.

One player, the Chief, takes one of the 100 illustrated cards and reads it to himself. The front of the card has the mystery, the back the solution. Then he reads the front of the card to the players and shows them the illustration. The other players are the detectives. Singly and together, they try to solve the mystery by asking the Chief questions. But he can only answer Yes, No, Close, or Not Relevant.

Here is a mystery:
Title: Nasty Finish
Excessive hurry led a man to a stinky situation.
The picture on the card shows a man about to step into it.

What’s going on?

The detectives discuss and try to form theories that can be proved or disproved by their questions:
Is the man afraid? - no
Did the man die? - yes
Was he murdered?- no

So it must have been an accident…

Now we're getting somewhere…

Bit by bit the detectives try to piece together the mystery. Often a question from one detective will give another an idea for a whole new line of questioning. There is no winner or loser but when you finally solve the mystery, you feel brilliant!

The mysteries, while not all crimes, are morbid and twisted and often very funny. You need to discuss, question and think outside of the box in order to solve them. Great fun, you can play almost anywhere, anytime. In the car, at the dinner table or at a gathering, all are perfect for this co-cop mystery solving game.

This volume contains 100 cases. 
For Black Stories fans, this second volume includes never before published in English, translations of Black Stories Funny Death and Black Stories Shit Happens.

- description by the publisher

Name: Mystery Detective Vol. 1: Classic Cases
Description:
Mystery Detective is a mystery solving party game that you can start playing almost as soon as you open the box.

One player, the Chief, takes one of the 100 illustrated cards and reads it to himself. The front of the card has the mystery, the back the solution. Then he reads the front of the card to the players and shows them the illustration. The other players are the detectives. Singly and together, they try to solve the mystery by asking the Chief questions. But he can only answer Yes, No, Close, or Not Relevant.

Here is the first mystery:
A woman dies because she was on the phone too long.

We often talk too long on the phone but don't die! What's going on?

The detectives discuss and try to form theories that can be proved or disproved by their questions:
A lovers' quarrel?
Was the woman killed by her husband? - no
By her lover?- no

Okay, maybe international espionage:
Was the woman a spy? - no, not relevant

Hmm. Maybe we can localize this.
Was the woman lying down?- no
Standing up? - no
Sitting?  - YES!!

Now we're getting somewhere…

Bit by bit the detectives try to piece together the mystery. Often a question from one detective will give another an idea for a whole new line of questioning. There is no winner or loser but when you finally solve the mystery, you feel brilliant!

The mysteries, while not all crimes, are morbid and twisted and often very funny. You need to discuss, question and think outside of the box in order to solve them. Great fun, you can play almost anywhere, anytime. In the car, at the dinner table or at a gathering, all are perfect for this co-cop mystery solving game.

This volume contains 100 cases. 
For Black Stories fans, this first volume includes new translations of Black Stories 1 and 2.

-description from the publisher

Name: Die Legenden von Andor: Wassermagierin Heldentableau
Description:
Wassermagierin Heldentableau is an expansion for Legends of Andor and was offered through various contests on the Andor website.  This board is also available for download on the German Legenden-von-Andor.de website.

Die Wassermagier aus dem Land Danwar waren mächtige Wesen, die die Kräfte des Wassers für ihre eigenen Zwecke nutzten, indem sie eins mit dem Wasser wurden.

The water mages from Danwar are powerful beings who use the powers of water for their own purposes by becoming one with the water.

With this hero board, the The Legends of Andor is expanded with an additional strong heroine and an equally strong hero. Jarid and Jarim will replace the warrior Mairen or Thorn and will be played using the blue dice, disks and cube. As a special ability this hero can travel from one unused fountain to another. The willpower from these fountains (6 WP) can be distributed amongst the other heroes. Jarid and Jarim must leave behind gold, gemstones, objects, wood, pawns, or other figures when traveling between wells.

Name: Blades and Spirits
Description:
2019 Summer One Page PnP Contest Entry

(contains references to drinking; if that bothers you the game is probably not for you)

The end game is simple - end up with more fingers left on your hand than your opponent.  Battle against one opponent to drink your spirits the fastest by rolling dice and playing cards.  Simple, easy-to-learn game play; very transportable to take wherever.

—description from the designer

Name: Calx
Description:
An area control game that gradually raises the stakes.

Cards are arranged in a line from the least valuable to the most valuable. On their turn a player must either claim a card, place a marker on the least valuable occupied card or least valued unoccupied card, or move an existing marker equal to the number of markers on their current card. If they move off the end of the line however, their marker is lost without scoring. When all of the cards have been removed or claimed, the player with the most valuable collection wins.

This is a print and play game. In addition you will need 8 markers per player.

—description from the designer

Name: Fall of Ming: Jisi Incident
Description:
Fall of Ming: Jisi Incident is low-complexity wargame on the Jisi incident during ancient China. This is a 2 players wargame. One player control the army of Qing dynasty and one player control the army of Ming Dynasty.

The goal for army of Qing dynasty was to occupy the cities of Hebei Province.

—description from the designer
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Monikers: Classics
Description: Monikers: Classics - This box combines all the previous small box stand alone expansions: Monikers: Shmonikers, Monikers: Something Something, and Monikers: The Shut Up & Sit Down Nonsense Box

Name: Maestro!
Description:
The Maestros of Europe are missing!  Your mission is to find them and return them to their hometowns.

The 12 composer pawns are randomly, and secretly, placed at certain spots on the board, which is a map of Europe.  Each player is then given 4-6 info cards that states the composer's name, hometown, and some interesting facts about him.  Players roll dice to move around the board to secretly look at the composer pawns to see which Maestro is hiding there.  If it matches one of their cards, the player can then try to get the composer home.  Using the info on the cards, the player then has to roll and move to the composer's hometown.  The first person to get all their maestros home is the winner!

From the back of the box--

While you play, you will:
-Learn about twelve of history's master composers.
-Discover interesting facts about their careers, families, and travels.
-Navigate Europe to discover each composer's hometown, a significant city in their lives.
-Explore the map in the race to find and return your missing composers home.
-Apply strategy and memory skills to win the game.

Name: Matchify Card Game
Description:
No Messing Around ... When the fun starts, the last thing you want is anything complicated. Who wants fiddly pieces and a zillion rules? No way! Matchify says ... let's breeze through the rules in a few minutes, get everyone's round the table - and go for it!

Matchify uses two decks of cards (72 cards). Each card contains 9 symbols. Each card from the first deck has one symbol that can be matched with another symbol from any card in the second deck. For example, the 'Carrot' in the first card is matched with the 'Rabbit' in the second card in the Original theme. 'Bread' is matched with 'Wheat' in the MadeOf theme. 'Eiffel Tower' is matched with 'France' in the Travel theme. 'Banana' is matched with 'Fruits' in the TypeOf theme. 'Tractor' is matched with 'Farmer' in the Professions theme.

Fast-paced Card Game Best games are simple and fast - and Matchify is a high speed doozy. Compete to "catch the match" before your opponents. Sounds easy, but when the heat is on and everyone's racing to the top dog, that's when the challenge begins. This baby tests your observation, sharpens your language skills and powers up the fingers on buzzers factor. Addictive, clever and seriously challenging!

All for One & One for All! Perfect for 2 to 8 players. That's family, friends ... everyone in your tribe. Young children will love it! They are so smart they'll see the playing field is leveled for REAL . Great confidence booster! Field day for competitive teenagers, great for grandparents who remember proper games before computers .

4 cool games to kickstart the fun times. Start simple ... then get smarter. Play Valley, Mountains, Golden Frog or River Delta. And play to WIN. Once you've figured the basics you can go crazy! Get creative! These illustrated cards could even inspire stories. Perfect for imaginary friends and cuddlies!

Colorful, Hardwearing Packaging - and Portable! Fun in a tin never looked so good. 72 beautifully illustrated cards spread across 2 decks, plus easy-to-follow instructions. These colorful and engaging cards come safe and snug in a hardwearing tin. You'll want to play this game over and over - which is why it's made to last. Travels anywhere you want to go - tabletop to car seat, airport to beach.

Just add family and friends, sprinkle with enthusiasm - and you're ready to roll.

Instruction set is available in five languages: English, French, Italian, German, and Spanish.

5 Themes available: Original, MadeOf, TypeOf, Professions and Travel.

Matchify - Your New House Favorite

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Core Set 2020
Description:
Core Set 2020, also known as Core 2020, is the 19th Magic core set. It will be released on July 12, 2019.

The set contains 280 cards (20 basic land, 111 common, 80 uncommon, 53 rare, and 16 mythic rare) and includes randomly inserted premium versions of all cards. 1:45 cards are foil, instead of the usual 1:67. A unique Buy-a-Box promotional card numbered #281/280 is also considered to be part of the set. 52 additional cards are found in the set's planeswalker decks (#282/280 to #301/280) and Spellslinger Starter Kit (#302/280 to #337/280). Core Set 2020 introduced full-art tokens.
Chandra Nalaar is the face of Core Set 2020 card set, and is represented by three different planeswalker cards in different rarities and depicting several facets in her life.

Starting with tabletop Core Set 2020 Preleases on July 5, the London mulligan will be used for all play. It will become officially reflected in the comprehensive rules with the M20 rules updates on July 12. To take this mulligan, a player shuffles the cards in their hand back into their library, draws a new hand of cards equal to their starting hand size, then puts a number of those cards equal to the number of times that player has taken a mulligan on the bottom of their library in any order.

Name: 1D Girl Talk: The Game
Description:
Grab your friends and take center stage to prove you're 1D's number one fan!

Answer trivia questions, perform actions or complete dares to add cool 1D souvenirs to your collection.

The first player to complete her collection wins the VIP backstage pass... and the game!

Will you be the first to complete your game card and make it backstage?

Name: Pro Jockey
Description:
Pro Jockey is a game for 2-6 players or "Jockeys" from the age of ten upwards which brings into the home all the action and challenge, the triumphs and the disasters of the increasingly popular sport of National Hunt racing. All the features that combine to create the atmosphere of excitement that surrounds a big race at Aintree or Cheltenham have been provided - good or soft going, handicapping, horses can fall and good jumping and riding earns its rewards. Even after the last fence is jumped, the result is not clear and all the excitement of steeplechasing carries on until the winners and placed horses are past the post.

—description from the rulebook

Name: Dust 1947: Heavy Grenadiers Headquarters
Description:
Officially designed schwer SturmGrenadiere KommandoTrupp, the Heavy Grenadier Command Squad leads Heavy Grenadiers forces into battle, directly from the front line. The squad is equipped with three squad sized support weapons, two Maschinengewehr 44 Zwilling (twin-linked MG44Z) and one Fliegerfaust, taking advantage of the incredible strength their armor gives. It also has an array of radios to relay orders around the battlefield. Although part of a Command Squad, these men are very capable of taking the fight to the enemy. These are seasoned soldiers before anything else! With them come the formidable warrior that is Lieutenant Lara Walter. One of the deadliest Hero in the World of Dust, she greatly boosts the offensive capabilities of any Heavy Grenadier Squad.

This reference comes with two Dust 1947 unit cards, for the Axis Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

Name: Dust 1947: Devastator / Punisher II – Super Heavy Walker
Description:
The Devastator and the Punisher II are the two heaviest walkers found in the Grand Allied Army... and on the planet! These gigantic towering beasts strike fear into any pilot or soldier who faces them in combat. Their destructive power is unmatched, as well as their survivability on the battlefield. This is the true might of the Allies.
This reference allows you to field one of these two variants.

This reference comes with two Dust 1947 unit cards, one for each variant, both for the Allied Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

Name: Dust 1947: Spetsnaz Natasha (TSH) / Anatoly (TSH)
Description:
Armed with two Howitzers, the Natasha is a staple of SSU forces around the planet. This tropicalized variant is used by the dreaded Spetsnaz, who enjoy the firepower and versatility of this walker. With its Tesla guns, the Anatoly can engage even the heaviest targets. Such punch for such a light package make this walker a favorite of the Spetsnaz forces, who always need more of this rightly feared vehicle.
This reference allows you to field one of these two variants.

This reference comes with two Dust 1947 unit cards, one for each variant, both for the Spetsnaz Faction of the SSU Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

Name: Shards of Infinity: Shadow of Salvation
Description:
The fate of the world is in your hands...

In Shards of Infinity: Shadow of Salvation, the third installment of the award-winning deck-building game, players can choose one of two modes to play! Play a classic game of Shards using the hero Rez's new Relics and Allies to take down your opponents in player vs. player battles OR heed the warning of the time-traveling Rez and play co-operatively in a new campaign mode to battle through a series of bosses with up to four of your friends!

In co-operative mode, you read from the innovative "Battle Book", which tells a branching story. As the time-traveling Rez, you must decide which threat to take on with your team. Every choice has a consequence, as does your success or failure against these growing threats.
